subclusters.subcluster_name: Multiple Hormone Deficiency and Circadian Dysregulation Theory
Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune-Neuroendocrine Homeostatic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on integration of immune and neuroendocrine systems maintaining homeostasis and their dysregulation driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune-Neuroendocrine Homeostatic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hormonal decline impacting immune function and immunosenescence, linking immune and neuroendocrine aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune-Neuroendocrine Homeostatic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on hypothalamic inflammation and neuroimmune crosstalk causing systemic aging, linking neuroendocrine and immune dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune-Neuroendocrine Homeostatic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects chronic inflammation, neuroendocrine disorders, and metabolic syndrome via tryptophan-kynurenine pathway dysregulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Immune-Neuroendocrine Homeostatic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hormonal modulation of oxidative stress and apoptosis pathways affecting aging, linking endocrine and immune stress responses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Multiple Hormone Deficiency and Circadian Dysregulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on progressive decline and circadian desynchronization of multiple hormones as primary drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Multiple Hormone Deficiency and Circadian Dysregulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes hormonal decline (GH, IGF-1, sex steroids, DHEA) causing systemic aging and explores hormone replacement therapy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Multiple Hormone Deficiency and Circadian Dysregulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links decline of circulating hormones to molecular and cellular aging processes, using skin as a systemic aging model.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Multiple Hormone Deficiency and Circadian Dysregulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes systemic neurohumoral regulation decline and altered brain integrative activity reducing adaptive capacity with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes a central brain aging clock regulating peripheral aging via neuroendocrine signals and neurotransmitter metabolism changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hypothalamic dysfunction and neurotransmitter decline causing systemic aging events, reversible by restoring catecholamines.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hypothalamic threshold elevation and homeostatic deviation as programmed processes linking development and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents aging as decline in neuroendocrine central control system with slowed nerve transmission and loss of redundancy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details brain-gonad endocrine communication via HPG axis influencing sex-specific aging and longevity patterns.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes stomatogastric nervous system regulation of midgut tissue homeostasis via neural factors affecting apoptosis and regeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic and environmental control of aging with event-dependent physiological changes, linking neuroendocrine regulation to lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Brain-gut neuroendocrine circuits in C. elegans regulate longevity via temperature-sensitive neurotransmitter and hormone signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Central Neuroendocrine Regulation and Aging Clock Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Serotonin and octopamine neurotransmission modulate lifespan by altering food perception and mimicking dietary restriction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on GH/IGF-1 signaling regulating aging and longevity through modulation of chronic inflammation and metabolic profiles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes GH/IGF-1 axis decline affecting oxidative stress resistance and epigenetic regulation influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: GH deficiency remodels hypothalamic neural circuits and reduces inflammation, extending lifespan; early GH exposure reverses effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hypothalamic GHRH deficiency causes somatopause and GH decline, implicating neuroendocrine regulation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: GHRH neuron degeneration reduces GH secretion, causing bone aging phenotypes, linking neuroendocrine dysfunction to tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: NER genome instability triggers adaptive dampening of GH/IGF-1 axis resembling dwarfism and calorie restriction, linking DNA repair to neuroendocrine aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Nutrient-sensing pathways including GH-IGF-1 axis regulate aging and longevity via neuroendocrine adaptation to food availability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: GH/IGF-1 Axis and Inflammation Modulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Endocrine regulation of lifespan via pleiotropic hormones including GH and IGF-1, with low basal levels linked to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Regulation of Mitochondrial Oxidative Phosphorylation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Hormonal control of cytochrome c oxidase activity regulates mitochondrial ROS production, linking endocrine signaling to oxidative damage in aging.
